DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Detection Flow Cytometry Method Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the disease or disorder was detected via flow cytometry.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Detection Flow Cytometry Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying._A technique for counting, examining and sorting microscopic particles suspended in a stream of fluid._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:No value exists.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.

Property.preferredDefinition: A technique for counting, examining and sorting microscopic particles suspended in a stream of fluid.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: A technique for counting, examining and sorting microscopic particles suspended in a stream of fluid.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.
